website_summaries.verdict: A go-to heat gun for everything from paint removal to fanning a charcoal flame (though that's probably not recommended). Users are urged to read the manual before cranking this one up, so they're not surprised by the auto-cool feature.
pros: Heats up fast and very hot
Temperature and speed control buttons are easily accessible at the back of the unit
Digital readout is helpful, as is auto-cool safety setting
Users find this generally reliable and consistent for a variety of jobs
cons: Unit must run on the “cool” setting for awhile before it can be shut off, which annoys some users who are in a hurry

customer_reviews.title: Well made and gets quite hot. Be sure to read instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I didn't read the manual and thought it was defective when, after running on full-heat for a while, it wouldn't turn off. Turns out that it needs to run on the cool setting for a little while to cool itself down. Otherwise, you could set it down and the tip could light something on fire. Actually a pretty clever safety feature. Very pleased with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Markus33

customer_reviews.title: So far, highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.text: I can't attest to how long this will last, but it seems like a really nice heat gun. I am glad I spent a few extra bucks to get this. Buttons on the back are easy to control, it can get to something like over 1000 degrees (yikes). What I like the mot is the automatic cool down. Turn it off and set it pointing up on a flat surface and it will cool it down and shut off. Feels built well. It came with 2 extra attachments. Now just looking for things to melt unnecessarily. Hope I don't burn my house down.
customer_reviews.author: SRHadden

customer_reviews.title: Great way to light charcoal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heat gun for what may be considered an unconventional use: lighting my lump charcoal for the grill. This thing worked perfectly. It did exactly what I was hoping it could do. I put the heat and fan setting on high and in just a few moments I had a nice flame going. Not only does it ignite the coals but the blowing hot air does a great job stoking the fire and spreading it to the entire pile of coals. I have a traditional electric coal starter but trying this out, it worked much faster and was more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot C.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great, Feels Great, DOA???
customer_reviews.text: I just received mine yesterday, looks great feels great just won't turn on. When you plug it in and hit power a few of the lights just flicker and that's it, does nothing else. If you hold the power button the lights keep flickering. Really needed it for this weekend, whish I would have tested it when it arrived yesterday. Probably could have bought a different one and had it arrive on time. Now the question is, do I file for warranty or return to Amazon? Does anyone know if Wagner pays the return shipping?
customer_reviews.author: Don N.

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long ...
customer_reviews.text: What did I ever do before I had this heat gun. Very pleased. In the first couple of weeks, I have used it to form (flare) pvc pipe, heat a difficult to install bike tire and it stretched just enough to fit without prying with a tool, to warm a can of glue (on a cold day) for a mirror installer at my house and to remove dealership stickers on the back of two cars. A tool / investment that you will use ... over and over and over ... again.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Handle has been getting uncomfortably hot. Hmmm.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how I feel about this. I use it for working in an art studio with wax and have used it on and off for several months. Lately, the handle has been getting uncomfortably warm in my hand, near the top of the handle where the trigger would be if it were a gun. I have to set it aside and let it cool and even then, after a few minutes of use, it starts getting hot again in the same place. I was hoping it would last longer but I'm not sure how much longer I want to use it.
customer_reviews.author: MichiganTraveler

customer_reviews.title: hot enough
customer_reviews.text: We bought this primarily for use with shrink tubing. The temperature settings may be overstated as we have had to use the 400+ degree settings on high fan setting to shrink the tubing. The automatic cool-down feature is a good safety measure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Heat Gun
customer_reviews.text: The HT3500 is a great heat gun. Feels better, more substantial in the hand than the highly rated off brand I bought and returned before it. It has six heat settings, up to 1350°, and a cool down cycle. These are located on the base. You just set and point, no trigger necessary. This comes in handy for long jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Pete T.

customer_reviews.title: and the temperature controller is a very nice option. It only comes with the two accessory ...
customer_reviews.text: While this is by no means a "top of the line" device, it definitely gets the job done, and the temperature controller is a very nice option. It only comes with the two accessory nozzles pictured, but they seem to fit the heat gun and work the way they are supposed to. I think this is probably the best heat gun you can get for less than fifty dollars.
customer_reviews.author: O'Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this for melting down plastic jugs into mallet heads which it works great for. I've also used it to bend pvc conduit, and shape kydex. Oh yeah, and for polishing boots! It works great, I don't even know what people normally use them for.
customer_reviews.author: Desert ape

customer_reviews.title: now I have a new one and it's great. It has a nice range of temp settings ...
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before but lost it in the Santa Rosa Fires, now I have a new one and it's great. It has a nice range of temp settings and fan settings, ideal for shrink tube work on electrical connectors and many other tasks. Good quality heat gun, love it.
customer_reviews.author: deddy

customer_reviews.title: Simple & works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for applying vinyl on my car and it works well. Has a simple interface and seems like it will last me years without causing me any problems. Basically a hair dryer/ blow dryer on roids. Heats up very quick and has a cool down feature which I appreciate because it will keep the tool lasting longer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Can't turn the terrible thing off
customer_reviews.text: You can't turn it off without unplugging it. Such a pain. Actually seems dangerous because as you're working you invariably set the thing down on the table. Just save yourself the trouble of burning the studio down and avoid this awful thing. It's scary and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Park

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable temperature heat gun
customer_reviews.text: I like that the rear of the heat gun is flat and can be used to set it down. The gun heats up quickly enough, and the auto-cooling function seems useful. The gun is slightly bulky, and the power cord is stiff in cold rooms, which can be annoying if your work space is crowded.
customer_reviews.author: relativity17

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily. I have had it for almost 2 months now. It was my first digital heat gun, so it took me a min to figure it out but it’s stood up to the test well.
customer_reviews.author: lane

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for buck!
customer_reviews.text: Iv only used this a couple times so far but its worked perfectly each time. Heats up super quick and the cool downs just as fast. The dual settings make this tool very versatile for any job!
customer_reviews.author: Jim bob

customer_reviews.title: great works really fast
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact it heats up fast and gets the job done but time will tell how will it holds up !
customer_reviews.author: paceman

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Multiple temps and fan speeds make this very good tool for heating my work up
customer_reviews.author: McLuvvin

customer_reviews.title: Stopping heating ruined my project
customer_reviews.text: Broken during the first use- the suddenly stopped heating ruined my project
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I have used this heat gun for over 2-years without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: and the are great. But there is a major difference between those ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the older models, and the are great. But there is a major difference between those and this. The temperature selector is very good. I can burn out a commode flange in 10 mins with this thing. I am usually not a fan of electronics on tools, but this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Eaker

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: You Canvas Works this is how we relax our material to make it lay flat around a hard curve can control heat perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kinder

customer_reviews.title: Great Heat Gun.
customer_reviews.text: The wide range of digital heat settings make this a great tool for everything from melting frozen pipes to removing multi layers of paint.at 1300 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Old model, previously used.
customer_reviews.text: I received this and found that it had no additional nozzles and did not produce hear further than a couple inches in front, on high.
customer_reviews.author: Lubbock

customer_reviews.title: really does the job
customer_reviews.text: every garage needs one of these. really does the job. watch out, can burn your fingers or hands very quickly -- use gloves. Seems like you could weld aluminum with this it gets so hot.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon & Tony D

customer_reviews.title: The right heat gun for you.
customer_reviews.text: I am thankful for this product. I used it to connect fuel lines before installing. Be careful of the heat you use. I like the digital gauge reader and the fact when you turn it off, the motor cools off then shuts down.
customer_reviews.author: Landis Odoms

customer_reviews.title: This is a great price for a very nice heat gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for a very nice heat gun. I've used it so far for shrink wrap, removing decals, removing stress marks from ATV plastics, and even warming the adhesive holding an iPhone battery in.
customer_reviews.author: Fireballsocal

customer_reviews.title: I love this Gun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully working heat Gun. The heat adjustability and relatively quick start up is a very nice feature but the cooling down fan is a major plus for this product. You won't go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sutiikare

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Durable and lasting! We use these in our shop regularly and they just keep going & going!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice.. Digital readout. Much better than the cheapie I had been using that nearly set my house on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great so far, Great Heat Control and glad it cools on its own
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Llamas

customer_reviews.title: This is an incredible purchase for the price. Here's ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible purchase for the price. Here's the pros and cons after ~20 hours of stripping paint: Pros: - Digital control of fan speed and temp - Auto cool-down period after use - Includes two attachments Cons: - None encountered so far
customer_reviews.author: B. P. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Used to strip paint from guitars. Works great. Quality as expected.
customer_reviews.author: BA HOlt

customer_reviews.title: I bought this heat gun to apply vinyl wrap to ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heat gun to apply vinyl wrap to my cars. It' served me well and I've been able to use it to remove old paint protection film that was being a real pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing product we r very happy for making the right ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product we r very happy for making the right choice and bought the best thing we need the most and does our work much easier and professional
customer_reviews.author: Lemar

customer_reviews.title: Save Gas
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've only used a few times, but now that I have it, I find uses for it. Does many jobs that one would normally use a torch for.
customer_reviews.author: Dave the Jib Operator

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. Heats up very quickly, and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Heats up very quickly, and cools off automatically when done. Many settings for temp.
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Used it for about 30 minutes doing some 3M vynil ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it for about 30 minutes doing some 3M vynil work and it started to make a clicking sound and then began smoking from the back of the heat gun. Not worth the time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternate Use
customer_reviews.text: I use this gun to light my lump charcoal in my Big Green Egg and it works like a charm and has a complete fire in less than 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: HLooks very sturdy.  Update:  i dropped it and it stopped working.  Excellent customer service because they repaced it right
customer_reviews.text: Looks. Like high quality. Help me with a lot pf my wires. Also for some food, like steak, crospy pork skin, etc
customer_reviews.author: pamboy

customer_reviews.title: GoodValue and Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: This unit has enough power and speed settings to do anything you need. That attachments are useful for various uses. I've had good luck with it.
customer_reviews.author: Donn Werrbach

customer_reviews.title: These heat guns are better than most
customer_reviews.text: These heat guns are better than most. I use it for work as a Graphic Installer, and this thing runs for about 6 hours a day and the last one lasted about 3 years. Also I'm very hard on my equipment and this holds up to the abuse I give it.
customer_reviews.author: RIVER W.

customer_reviews.title: More temperature settings makes the Wagner Digital Heat Gun the winner in my book.
customer_reviews.text: I use a heat gun to remove the glass panel on a Macbook Pro laptop. Most of the heat guns start at 450 and that is more heat than I need. This unit has lots of settings to allow me to dial up just as much heat as I need.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Harris

customer_reviews.title: I use this to light my pure lump charcoal in ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to light my pure lump charcoal in my kamado/ceramic cooker/grille. In a few minutes the charcoal is flaming hot. The cool-down feature is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should!
customer_reviews.text: Quality heat gun, works great. Used right away for cell phone glass replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Teats

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect and arrived in two days
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another heat gun which did not heat to desired temperature This Wagner heat gun with digital display heated to required temperature in a very short time. Worked perfect and arrived in two days.
customer_reviews.author: hagar42

customer_reviews.title: Works great - no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Hot Gun! Works great - no complaints. Easy to use and heats up fast.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: It works great for that purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for one express reason, to light charcoal. It was a few dollars cheaper than the looftlighter and actually has a higher wattage (ie can product more heat). It works great for that purpose. Would probably work great for all uses as it seems to be a well made product. Consider this as an alternative to the looftlighter though.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan L Gab

customer_reviews.title: It's a potter's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: A potter's best friend!!! I love the auto-cool safety feature when you power it off!
customer_reviews.author: Funxsized

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beats the other products listed to start lump charcoal for the BGE! Safely cools down and shuts itself off.
customer_reviews.author: Astrorph

customer_reviews.title: Good Heat Gun!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! It fills all my needs that I require of it. Very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 😩Totalky Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The worst I’ve ever owned. I was looking forward to using this for doing my resin paintings. The heat keeps the resin fluid longer and the air is supposed to move it around. Sadly, this one doesn’t have enough breath to lift a feather. Changing the temperature is fine and appreciated, but without more air, it’s if little use to me. I’ve purchased another one of a different brand. Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: JUDY SAND

customer_reviews.title: The velocity options are low and lower and it works fine for shrinking plastic and texturing extruded insulation foam for ...
customer_reviews.text: Guess I expected more "horsepower and torque". Stripping paint...forget it...you'll spend your retirement on the electricity to run this thing. I thought I could use it to strip a mailbox post. Not a chance. Buy a chemical stripper. The velocity options are low and lower and it works fine for shrinking plastic and texturing extruded insulation foam for Halloween projects but ... for a no-kidding paint removal tool for an area larger than a dinner plate...forget it. No muscle and not enough heated air volume.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product with many uses
customer_reviews.text: Love this. It really heats up quickly and does the job. I used it together with the Super Cold Spray to perform and paint-less dent removal from my car. It took patience and three cans of MG Chemicals 403 134A Super Cold Spray, 400g, but it worked. I got the idea from a YouTube video on paint-less dent removal.
customer_reviews.author: Hattie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The controls were intuitive and this gun worked well in repairing an iPad.
customer_reviews.author: pde

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used primarily to light lump charcoal and it performs perfectly. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. Willis

customer_reviews.title: ... to light my ceramic Primo grill and it works wonderfully. Item as described
customer_reviews.text: I use this to light my ceramic Primo grill and it works wonderfully. Item as described. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: press again to go into cool mode.
customer_reviews.text: The power button is weird....press once to turn on...press again to go into cool mode....pressing it a third time does nothing you have to delicately massage the button with very little pressure to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great product . . . UPDATE!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this Wagner heat gun (purchased in July, 2018) almost daily, and it has become indispensable! I made a holster for it on the side of my electronics bench. When I turn the heat gun off it goes into the holster pointing down at the floor for the automatic cool down phase. The controls on this product are excellent :-)
customer_reviews.author: Imageman

customer_reviews.title: Autocool function makes it quick and easy to put away
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to light the BGE! What a pleasure. You can't go wrong with this one. Autocool function makes it quick and easy to put away.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Good price. OK heat gun
customer_reviews.text: It's an OK heat gun. Similar to the Wagner HT1000 heat gun just some fancier buttons and unnecessary features. Unless you need it for a specific temperature for a specific job your better off buying the cheaper model. Also has a bulky short cord that doesn't straighten out to we'll.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the specific tool purchased for smoker that died ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it to use on startng the wood in our outdoor ceramic smoker. Works better than the specific tool purchased for smoker that died after less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: does this item have any warrenty left? It stopped working in Sept 2016.
customer_reviews.author: bob bowen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of kit but wish the narrow nozzle was also included in the package.
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: It's GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. You will definitely be pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: oldguy

product_meta.title: Wagner 0503040 HT3500 Digital Heat Gun, 12 Temp Settings 250ᵒF-1350ᵒF, soften paint, caulking, adhesive, putty for removal, shrink wrap, bend plastic pipes, and loosen rusted nuts or bolts
product_meta.description: Turn up the heat on your next project. The HT3500 is the first digital heat gun introduced into the DIY market. Digital circuitry provides multiple benefits. Touch-pads activate 12 distinct temperature settings from 250° to 1350° F. enabling the user to match the correct temperature to the application. Additionally, the digital circuitry provides logic to the HT3500. When the cool setting is selected, the gun will cool itself to a preset temperature and automatically turn itself off.
feature_bullets: 12 temperature settings from 250° - 1350° F for consistent results and performance
Ergonomic handle for a comfortable grip and reduced fatigue
Two fan speeds for optimum air flow control
A cool-down and automatic shut-off setting to improve tool life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars157 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
